decision_conditions:
The Development hereby permitted shall only be carried out and completed strictly in accordance with the submitted plans hereby approved and any subsequent approval of details.


REASON: To ensure that the development hereby permitted is carried out in full accordance with the plans hereby approved.

The Development hereby permitted must be begun not later than the expiration of three years beginning with the date of this consent.


REASON: In order to comply with the provisions of Section 18(a) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 as amended.

<p><b style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">Works to match existing<br></b><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">All new works, and works of making good to the retained fabric, whether internal or external, shall be finished to match the original work with regard to the methods used and to material, dimensions, composition, form, colour, finish and profile, and in the case of brickwork, facebond and pointing.</span><br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;"><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">REASON: In accordance with Section 17 (1) (b) of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and to ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building under Sections 16 and 66 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, December 2023, Paragraphs 195 to 214; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</span><br></p>

<p><b style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">Cleaning of brickwork<br></b><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">No permission is granted for any cleaning of brickwork, other than a gentle surface clean using a nebulous water spray.&nbsp; A method statement shall be submitted to and approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any cleaning, other than a test patch in a discreet location.&nbsp; The test patch shall be approved in writing by the Local Planning Authority prior to any cleaning.&nbsp; The works shall not be carried out otherwise than in accordance with the approved details.&nbsp; No permission is granted for any sandblasting of brickwork.</span><br style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;"><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building under Sections 16 and 66 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, December 2023, Paragraphs 195 to 214; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</span><br></p>

<p><b style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">Bedding, pointing and rendering to be in lime<br></b><span style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">All new, rebuilt and reinstated brickwork shall be bedded, pointed and rendered using a lime mortar.&nbsp; Cementitious mortars shall not be used.&nbsp; Pointing shall match the existing pointing throughout.&nbsp;</span></p><div style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building under Sections 16 and 66 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, December 2023, Paragraphs 195 to 214; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</div>

<div style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;"><b>Second Hand Bricks&nbsp;</b></div><div style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;"><span style="color: rgb(51, 51, 51); font-family: &quot;Helvetica Neue&quot;, Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif; font-size: 14px; text-align: justify;">Where second-hand or salvaged bricks are to be used, these are to be entirely cleaned of paint, soot and any other coatings before reuse.&nbsp;</span><b><br></b></div><div style="color: rgb(34, 34, 34); font-family: Arial, Helvetica, sans-serif; font-size: small;">REASON: To ensure that special regard is paid to protecting the special architectural and historic interest and integrity of the building under Sections 16 and 66 of the Planning (Listed Buildings and Conservation Areas) Act 1990 and National Planning Policy Framework, December 2023, Paragraphs 195 to 214; The London Plan 2021 Policy HC1 Heritage conservation and growth; and Hackney Local Plan 2033, Policies LP1 Design Quality and Local Character, LP3 Designated Heritage Assets and LP4 Non Designated Heritage Assets.</div>
description: Overlay the existing roof recovering with a new liquid system to the main flat roof, parapet wall repairs including removal of cementitious render and installation of angled PIR fillet, removal of buddleia & vegetation to elevations, brickwork/stonework repairs where necessary and internal making good to rectify water ingress.
